summary: The Agricultural Biotechnology Coordination Act (S. 2692) mandates the establishment of an Office of Biotechnology Policy within the Department of Agriculture. This office will be responsible for coordinating the Department's policies and activities concerning biotechnology, biomanufacturing, and related technologies. Its duties include research and development, communication, regulation and labeling, commercialization, and interagency coordination (EPA, FDA, and others). The office will also engage in consultations with various stakeholders like biotechnology developers and agricultural producers. The bill aims to streamline and prioritize biotechnology initiatives within the USDA.
